data.title: John R. Freuler papers
data.text:
John Rudolph Freuler papers, 1910-1955 (bulk 1910-1930)

Finding Aid for the Collection at the Chicago History Museum, Research Center

© Copyright 2008, Chicago Historical Society, 1601 North Clark Street, Chicago, IL 60614-6038

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Title: John Rudolph Freuler papers [manuscript], 1910-1955 (bulk 1910-1930).

Main entry: Freuler, John R., 1872-1958.

Inclusive dates: 1910-1955 (bulk 1910-1930)

Size: 30 linear ft.

Accession #: 1990.0826

This finding aid contains

Description of the collection,

Description of some related material,

List of online catalog headings,

Provenance statement,

Storage designation,

Container list of box and folder numbers and titles.

Description of the collection,

Production files (primarily shooting scripts and promotional material), correspondence, incoming telegrams, minutes, financial ledgers, daily journals, contracts, scrapbooks, and sundry items of John Freuler, founder of the American Film Company and other film companies, relating to movie making, actors, production details, and finances. The companies operated out of Chicago, Illinois, with production studios in Santa Barbara, California.

The collection is arranged in 2 series:

1. General papers

2. Production records and files (primarily alphabetical by movie title)

Description of some related material:

Related materials at Chicago History Museum, Research Center, include the John Freuler film companies collection of visual materials (1990.0826).

List of online catalog headings:

Freuler, John R., 1872-1958.

Chaplin, Charlie, 1889-1977

American Film Manufacturing Company

Mutual Film Corporation

Motion picture industry--Illinois--Chicago--20th century.

Motion picture industry--California--Santa Barbara--20th century.

Chicago (Ill.)--Commerce--20th century.

Chicago (Ill.)--Intellectual life--20th century.

Santa Barbara (Calif.)--Commerce--20th century.

Form/genre:

Account books.

Contracts.

Correspondence.

Minutes.

Scrapbooks.

Scripts.

Telegrams.

Added entries:

Chaplin, Charlie, 1889-1977

American Film Manufacturing Company

Mutual Film Corporation

United States--Illinois--Cook County--Chicago.

Provenance statement:

Gift of Jessie Walker Griggs in August 1990 (1990.0826).

Storage designation:
